commit_message:
ganesha: Add doc

Add doc for ganesha library specifying requirements, configuration
instructions, and limitations.

Change-Id: Ibcb1b047e9e64b0c11dab00a41eb8357c3f0a5a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/82/165482/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2015 Red Hat, Inc. All Rights Reserved. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Ganesha library =============== The Ganesha library provides base classes that can be used by drivers to implement provisioning shares via NFS (NFSv3 and NFSv4), utilizing the NFS-Ganesha NFS server. Supported Operations -------------------- - Allow NFS Share access - Deny NFS Share access Requirements ------------ NFS-Ganesha 2.1 or newer. NFS-Ganesha configuration ------------------------- The library is agnostic of general NFS-Ganesha (in sequel: Ganesha) configuration as much as it's possible. Ganesha's concept of storage backend modules are called FSAL ("File System Abstraction Layer"). We of course demand the enablement of the FSAL the driver code intends to leverage. Beyond that (with default Manila config) we need the following line in the ganesha config file (that defaults to /etc/ganesha/ganesha.conf): ``%include /etc/ganesha/export.d/INDEX.conf`` The above paths can be customized though Manila configuration. Using Ganesha library in drivers -------------------------------- A driver that wants to use the Ganesha library has to inherit from ``driver.GaneshaMixin``. The driver has to contain a subclass of ``ganesha.GaneshaNASHelper``, instantiate it along with the driver instance and delegate ``allow_access`` and ``deny_access`` methods to it (when appropriate, ie. when ``access_proto`` is NFS). In the sequel we explain what has to be implemented by the ``ganesha.GaneshaNASHelper`` subclass (to which we refer as "helper class").. Ganesha exports (in Ganesha 2.*) are described by so-called *Ganesha export blocks* (snippets of Ganesha config specifying key-pair values). The Ganesha library generates sane default export blocks for the exports it manages, with one thing left blank, the so-called *FSAL subblock*. The helper class has to implement the ``_fsal_hook`` method which returns the FSAL subblock (in Python represented as a dict with string keys and values). It has one mandatory key, ``Name``, to which the value should be the name of the FSAL (eg.: ``{"Name": "GLUSTER"}``). Further content of it is optional and FSAL specific. Customizing Ganesha exports --------------------------- As noted, the Ganesha library provides sane general defaults. However, the driver is allowed to: - customize defaults; - allow users to customize exports. The config format for Ganesha library is called *export block template*. They are syntactically either Ganesha export blocks, or isomorphic JSON (as Ganesha export blocks are by-and-large equivalent to arrayless JSON), with two special placeholders for values: ``@config`` and ``@runtime``. ``@config`` means a value that shall be filled from Manila config, and ``@runtime`` means a value that's filled at runtime with dynamic data. The library's defults are stored in *manila/share/drivers/ganesha/conf/00-base-export-template.conf* For customization, the driver has to extend the ``_default_config_hook`` method, and modify the argument (a dict representing an export block template) by loading export block templates from either a driver specfic location in the Manila source tree (to change defaults) or from a user exposed external location (to allow user to make changes), and merging the argument export block template with the loaded export block templates using the ``ganesha_utils.patch`` method. Known Restrictions ------------------ - The library does not support network segmented multi-tenancy model instead works over a flat network, where the tenants share a network. The :mod:`manila.share.drivers.ganesha` Module ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. automodule:: manila.share.drivers.ganesha :noindex: :members: :undoc-members: :show-inheritance:

commit_message:
Finish removing invocations of pip.

We don't depend on recursive installations via pip - and pip certainly
doesn't support that. We removed part of it recently, finish removing
it all.

Change-Id: I29bc4070b355e52124ceae459ea20403d134b60a

commit_message:
Improve strictness of AMT test cases error checking

The 'spec_set' option of Mock object directs stricter checking than
'spec' option.
The commit ef44187a8b210b7cfb03a6c9ab14c863c12df9bb assigned
'spec_set' to the external functions of PYWSMAN, but it assigned
'spec' to the internal functions.
This patch makes strictness of the error checking consistent among
AMT test cases.

Change-Id: Iefa654ff8f041afae67565284e709cad9eaf2a34

commit_message:
Adding sudo permissions to SSH Driver commands

Added 'sudo' to 'rm', 'mkdir', and 'kill' commands throughout the driver.

Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>

Add floating IP pool resource methods

This change add floating IP pool resource list method.
floating IP pool is a Nova API read-only resource.

Change-Id: I1c68a696926f45e93050f441404726d92a717900

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the 'License'); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """ test_floating_ip_pool ---------------------------------- Test floating IP pool resource (managed by nova) """ from mock import patch from shade import OpenStackCloud from shade import OpenStackCloudException from shade.tests.unit import base class PoolMock(object): # Because name is a reserved attribute for Mock... def __init__(self, **kwargs): super(PoolMock, self).__init__() for k, v in kwargs.items(): self.__setattr__(k, v) class TestFloatingIPPool(base.TestCase): mock_pools = [ {'name': 'pool1'}, {'name': 'pool2'}] def setUp(self): super(TestFloatingIPPool, self).setUp() self.client = OpenStackCloud('cloud', {}) @patch.object(OpenStackCloud, 'nova_client') def test_create_port(self, mock_nova_client): mock_nova_client.floating_ip_pools.list.return_value = [ PoolMock(**p) for p in self.mock_pools ] floating_ip_pools = self.client.list_floating_ip_pools() mock_nova_client.floating_ip_pools.list.assert_called_with() for p in floating_ip_pools: self.assertTrue('name' in p) names = [{'name': p['name']} for p in floating_ip_pools] self.assertItemsEqual(names, self.mock_pools) @patch.object(OpenStackCloud, 'nova_client') def test_create_port_exception(self, mock_nova_client): mock_nova_client.floating_ip_pools.list.side_effect = \ Exception('whatever') self.assertRaises( OpenStackCloudException, self.client.list_floating_ip_pools)

Commit 31a7924ecfae0b9c9fea0edc344f0e3ca2fe78a5 moved the code

commit_message:
Compute: detach volume prior to deleting instance

In the VMware driver detaching the volume requires accessing
the instance. If this instance is deleted prior to the detach
then this may lead to dataloss and corruption of the disk.

Commit 31a7924ecfae0b9c9fea0edc344f0e3ca2fe78a5 moved the code
to after destroy as it assumed that the instance deletion
did the detachment. But this is not the case for all drivers.

Closes-bug: #1439168

Change-Id: Ie5649dd5e2d9543d3446d506176bb62d1a67f9e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/183341/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for bdm in vol_bdms: try: connector = self.driver.get_volume_connector(instance) self.volume_api.terminate_connection(context, bdm.volume_id, connector) self.volume_api.detach(context, bdm.volume_id) except exception.DiskNotFound as exc: LOG.debug('Ignoring DiskNotFound: %s', exc, instance=instance) except exception.VolumeNotFound as exc: LOG.debug('Ignoring VolumeNotFound: %s', exc, instance=instance) except (cinder_exception.EndpointNotFound, keystone_exception.EndpointNotFound) as exc: LOG.warning(_LW('Ignoring EndpointNotFound: %s'), exc, instance=instance)
deleted_lines: for bdm in vol_bdms: try: # NOTE(vish): actual driver detach done in driver.destroy, so # just tell cinder that we are done with it. connector = self.driver.get_volume_connector(instance) self.volume_api.terminate_connection(context, bdm.volume_id, connector) self.volume_api.detach(context, bdm.volume_id) except exception.DiskNotFound as exc: LOG.debug('Ignoring DiskNotFound: %s', exc, instance=instance) except exception.VolumeNotFound as exc: LOG.debug('Ignoring VolumeNotFound: %s', exc, instance=instance) except (cinder_exception.EndpointNotFound, keystone_exception.EndpointNotFound) as exc: LOG.warning(_LW('Ignoring EndpointNotFound: %s'), exc, instance=instance)

commit_message:
Add validation for cinder volume

Add validation for cinder volume, should specify only one
of snapshot_id, image, source_volid if don't specify backup_id
or size.
And also add validation of image and imageRef, user can't
set both of them.

Change-Id: Ibc9e75c338d07896e399267c366dd9167229ba9d
Closes-Bug: #1451713
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/96/180096/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_cinder_create_with_snapshot_and_image(self): stack_name = 'test_exclusive_options' stack = utils.parse_stack(self.t, stack_name=stack_name) vp = stack.t['Resources']['volume2']['Properties'] vp['snapshot_id'] = 'snapshot-123' vp['image'] = 'image-123' rsrc = stack['volume2'] self.stub_ImageConstraint_validate() self.stub_SnapshotConstraint_validate() ex = self.assertRaises(exception.StackValidationFailed, rsrc.validate) self.assertIn('you should specify only one of image, source_volume ' 'or snapshot_id.', six.text_type(ex)) def test_cinder_create_with_snapshot_and_source_volume(self): stack_name = 'test_exclusive_options' stack = utils.parse_stack(self.t, stack_name=stack_name) vp = stack.t['Resources']['volume2']['Properties'] vp['snapshot_id'] = 'snapshot-123' vp['source_volid'] = 'source_volume-123' vp.pop('size') rsrc = stack['volume2'] self.stub_VolumeConstraint_validate() self.stub_SnapshotConstraint_validate() ex = self.assertRaises(exception.StackValidationFailed, rsrc.validate) self.assertIn('you should specify only one of image, source_volume ' 'or snapshot_id.', six.text_type(ex)) def test_cinder_create_no_size_no_options(self): stack_name = 'test_exclusive_options' stack = utils.parse_stack(self.t, stack_name=stack_name) vp = stack.t['Resources']['volume2']['Properties'] vp.pop('size') rsrc = stack['volume2'] self.stub_VolumeConstraint_validate() self.stub_SnapshotConstraint_validate() ex = self.assertRaises(exception.StackValidationFailed, rsrc.validate) self.assertIn('you should specify only one of image, source_volume ' 'or snapshot_id.', six.text_type(ex))
deleted_lines: imageRef='46988116-6703-4623-9dbc-2bc6d284021b', snapshot_id='snap-123', source_volid='vol-012', # Note that specifying all these arguments doesn't work in # practice, as they are conflicting, but we just want to check they # are sent to the backend. 'imageRef': '46988116-6703-4623-9dbc-2bc6d284021b', 'snapshot_id': 'snap-123', 'source_volid': 'vol-012',

commit_message:
OVS DVR UT: Reduce indentation depth

My motivation of this clean up is to reduce the size of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160245/ .

Change-Id: I9802bef47cad7cb205a37955e3a9077cd355a8fd

commit_message:
Replace ci.o.o links with docs.o.o/infra

The http://ci.openstack.org/ documentation site has been deprecated,
replaced by redirects to corresponding paths within
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/ where other Project Infrastructure
documentation already resides.

Change-Id: I0fb46f9901c2ca7cab3bd3233136b247e7773e5f

commit_message:
Deprecate nova ironic driver's admin_auth_token

The admin_auth_token config option is deprecated in the keystone
client and should similarly be deprecated in the ironic driver.

Change-Id: Ia9981b831ed9159ca3a01a8bb9d5eab7309f9a65
Closes-Bug: #1451605

commit_message:
Handle return code 2 from blkid calls

blkid returns code 2 if the requested TYPE key is not found
for the specified device.

Ensure that this situation is handled correctly; blkid will
not return any data, so the return value will be empty.

Change-Id: I38cd7b53cdfd694c0eba1b6054d8e4c33759b0b8
Closes-Bug: #1426324
(cherry picked from commit 051fced477cdead4e307c23fc343da427beb6c81)

added_lines: run_as_root=True, check_exit_code=[0, 2])

commit_message:
Improve wording in glance instructions

The landing page has a column for what to do
with glance images. It only talks about launching
with nova or horizon, but the glance section will
host images to be used with murano, heat, sahara,
etc., so this commit slightly modifies the
language to indicate that.

Change-Id: Icc341021efdcac7de7c025f7ea0a850adc93a67f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/app-catalog refs/changes/62/183362/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: <li>Use Nova to launch a vm from the new image (or Horizon to launch it directly from the Glance image list)

commit_message:
Ironic doesn't use cacert while talking to Swift

Current we have a keystonemiddleware.auth_token.cafile
which is used for talking to Openstack services using https.
Ironic doesn't pass this down to swiftclient for verifying
https connections.

Closes-Bug: 1454353
Change-Id: Id085ea6c0f1d072ec631b9851ddfde96852aca56

commit_message:
Replace self.properties.get on self.properties[]

Remove unnecessary using self.properties.get for more
clear code. Using properties.get(prop, default) causes
next issues:
1. properties.get(prop) if prop not in properties_schema
will return None instead of expected KeyError.
2. properties.get(prop, default) returns "default" value
if current properties is not presented in properties_schema.
So using self.properties.get() makes sense only when we plan
to use this property with default option in another resource,
which has not it in property schema.
This patch replaces this methods in resources/openstack folder.

Change-Id: I523eb3feacb0cb7a16a928a92896ce56188e376f

""" self.wait_interval = wait_interval self._signal_handlers_set.add(self._handle_signal) _set_signals_handler(self._handle_class_signals) self.readpipe.read(1) # Parent signals with SIGTERM when it wants us to go away. signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, signal.SIG_DFL) # Don't block if no child processes have exited pid, status = os.waitpid(0, os.WNOHANG) # Yield to other threads if no children have exited # Sleep for a short time to avoid excessive CPU usage # (see bug #1095346) eventlet.greenthread.sleep(self.wait_interval) cfg.CONF.reload_config_files() for service in set( [wrap.service for wrap in self.children.values()]): service.reset()

commit_message:
Set IPset hash type to 'net' instead of 'ip'

The previous hash type was 'ip' and this caused a major
issue with the allowed address pairs extension since it
results in CIDRs being passed to ipset. When the hash type
is 'ip', a CIDR is completely enumerated into all of its
addresses so 10.100.0.0/16 results in ~65k entries. This
meant a single allowed_address_pairs entry could easily
exhaust an entire set.

This patch changes the hash type to 'net', which is designed
to handle a CIDRs as a single entry.

This patch also changes the names of the ipsets because
creating an ipset with different parameters will cause an
error and our ipset manager code isn't robust enough to handle
that at this time.

Related-Bug: #1439817
Related-Bug: #1444397
(based on commit a38b5df5cd3c47672705aad4c30e789ae11ec958)

Change-Id: I8177699b157cd3eac46e2f481f47b5d966c49b07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/02/179402/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmd = ['ipset', 'create', '-exist', chain_name, 'hash:net', 'family', process_input = ["create %s hash:net family %s" % (new_chain_name, chain_type)]
deleted_lines: cmd = ['ipset', 'create', '-exist', chain_name, 'hash:ip', 'family', process_input = ["create %s hash:ip family %s" % (new_chain_name, chain_type)]

commit_message:
kolla: add sudo for setup_docker.sh

Otherwise, the script will fail.

Also add for tox invocation until potential group issue is sorted out
(group membership applied to current running shell).

Change-Id: Ic84d5435761deae0d28909c813cb1d87540fbb21

commit_message:
Deprecate quota_items, register resources upon REST initialization

Register 'core' resources when the respective rest controllers are
instantiated, rather than at module load time.

Since in this way there will not be any need to iterate over
quota_items, the option is being deprecated.

This patch does not supply unit tests as the already-existing
routine for registering a resource from quota_items is being
deprecated as well (and was not covered by any unit test beforehand).

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icdb744adfd86d38363239a454ccf04f3c6b9c158
Closes-Bug: #1453322
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/93/181593/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

libvirt: use instance UUID with exception InstanceNotFound

Ensure that the UUID is used when using the exception. A instance
name is not unique.

commit_message:
Don't create network resources for scenario utils

The scenario utils classes make a couple of API calls to flush out
a matrix for using testscenarios on test cases with several different
images and and flavors. Previously, this was hard coded to only use
configured credentials, which may or may not exist in different
configurations. When it was updated to allow the use of configured
credentials no network resource dict was used which could result in
unnecessary network resources being created. This commit addresses this
by explicitly telling the cred provider class that no network resources
need to be created.

Change-Id: Ica3fa823771123a2c6e1d863f19a6006acb36f74
Closes-Bug: #1454490

commit_message:
Group akanda sub-projects

This adds the akanda sub-projects to the 'akanda' group, hopefully
enabling patches to these projects to generate updates to LP bugs
on the akanda project.

commit_message:
Add block name to switch config options for MLX plug-ins.

In the INI files, the switch_names option uses a dynamic
value to determine the block names for the switch options.
In order to create proper config option reference docs,
there needs to be an example block name for the switch
options.

Change-Id: Ic5bf6de02ba1b7d1bc90ee29a5a0570fb45b9956
Closes-Bug: #1442357

commit_message:
proposal to add Chris Dent to Ceilometer core

i'd like to nominate Chris Dent to the Ceilometer core team.
he has been one of the leading reviewers in Ceilometer and gives
solid comments. he also has led the api effort in Ceilometer and
provides insight in specs.

reviews:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:openstack/ceilometer+reviewer:%22Chris+Dent%22,n,z

patches:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:openstack/ceilometer+owner:%22Chris+Dent%22,n,z

Change-Id: I1c3c88a8c1016390ff4d0d110d54213855c6b3fe

commit_message:
metering data ttl sql backend breaks resource metadata

The implementation for sql clear_expired_metering_data() uses delete()
on join() for four metatada tables, which will cause clear whole
tables no matter what join returns. And it associates metadata id
with sample id which makes no sense, the metadata id is resource's
internal id.

Change-Id: I98219bf27a0a765838d45386b7ae6b6b980b1ae9
Closes-Bug: #1419239
(cherry picked from commit 5a65b4de0fe46967e76832c2acf4924a53b18612)

commit_message:
Replace ci.o.o links with docs.o.o/infra

The http://ci.openstack.org/ documentation site has been deprecated,
replaced by redirects to corresponding paths within
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/ where other Project Infrastructure
documentation already resides.

Change-Id: I279ebb9526ce6c5010de94d631dfe75a2d32dab8

commit_message:
Retry a cell delete if host constraint fails

The instance.destroy method has a constraint that fails during a local
delete if the host is not None, because it should be in that case.
Cells calls local_delete when there's no cell_name on the instance, but
when this fails it's likely that we have a host and cell_name now so the
delete method should be attempted again.

Closes-Bug: 1454839
Change-Id: I412fab6f43cf2c64239a0292946c6c3bb9837110
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/72/182772/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: super(ComputeCellsAPI, self)._local_delete(context, instance, bdms, method_name, self._do_delete) return

subject: Misplaced parenthesis causing confusion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-06 13:51:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/guidelines.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.i18n/commit/01fd79d3a59e3ee702bc94229fcfa86b68e89013', 'message': 'Misplaced parenthesis causing confusion

The current example in the guidelines for using translation markers
has the closing parenthesis including the string as well as the
formatting argument. This has caused some confusion in reviews where
someone incorrectly follows this pattern and ends up with pep8 errors.

This patch corrects the closing parenthesis placement for both examples
in the "Avoid Forcing the Tranlation of Translatable Variable" section.

Change-Id: I5cd80c3ebec57a7e3686cac946427f7b6e6f3d6d
'}]
commit_message:
Misplaced parenthesis causing confusion

The current example in the guidelines for using translation markers
has the closing parenthesis including the string as well as the
formatting argument. This has caused some confusion in reviews where
someone incorrectly follows this pattern and ends up with pep8 errors.

This patch corrects the closing parenthesis placement for both examples
in the "Avoid Forcing the Tranlation of Translatable Variable" section.

Change-Id: I5cd80c3ebec57a7e3686cac946427f7b6e6f3d6d

commit_message:
Add the generic script-based benchmark for the VMs

Add the generic benchmark and context that uses a script to prepare
a benchmark image and a script to execute the benchmark and convert
results into JSON.

As instance we added the filesystem benchmark Blogbench [1] that can
be used for measuring the performance of a Virtual Machine by
reproducing the load of a real-world busy file server.

Rally gate jobs are updated to run a synthetic simple benchmark
that tests the framework's ability to create image and run a script.

[1] http://www.pureftpd.org/project/blogbench

Co-Authored-By: Tzanetos Balitsaris <tzabal@freebsd.org>
Implements: blueprint benchmark-vms
Change-Id: Ibe82a854a0b0d6b76861f262183196796e665cf2

subject: Make `tgtd' to open backing device with O_DIRECT
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-07 14:51:31.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/volume/iscsi.py', 'cinder/brick/iscsi/iscsi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/f53dcb1482d00793c82a655b237b462f9db2e95d', 'message': "Make `tgtd' to open backing device with O_DIRECT

The `tgtd' iSCSI target daemon opens a backing device using page cache
or cache write-through. Both of these degrade performance while first
causes `qemu' to hang-up during the fsync (2) call on the iSCSI device.

Fix these by instructing `tgtd' to open backing devices with O_DIRECT
by default and add appropriate configuration option.

Change-Id: I857e031b47a425a5d04a739ea520787dd126da73
Closes-Bug: #1375245
"}]
commit_message:
Make `tgtd' to open backing device with O_DIRECT

The `tgtd' iSCSI target daemon opens a backing device using page cache
or cache write-through. Both of these degrade performance while first
causes `qemu' to hang-up during the fsync (2) call on the iSCSI device.

Fix these by instructing `tgtd' to open backing devices with O_DIRECT
by default and add appropriate configuration option.

Change-Id: I857e031b47a425a5d04a739ea520787dd126da73
Closes-Bug: #1375245

commit_message:
Allow testing with specific pips

We want to use the new resolver branch of pip today, and perhaps
develop in future too. This introduces the same basic change we did to
pbr's tests to test with a custom pip.

Change-Id: Ia2b1a9c7ee7a7bf32f404932fe7fe872ac402b0e
Depends-On: I7600fa20391bb83491d630b277bf01cc3a20727c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/77/181777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Parameters # PBR_PIP_VERSION :- if not set, run pip's latest release, if set must be a # valid reference file entry describing what pip to use. # Bootstrappping the mkenv needs to install *a* pip export PIPVERSION=pip PIPFLAGS=${PIPFLAGS:-} $venv/bin/pip install -U $PIPVERSION wheel pbr# Specific PIP version - must succeed to be useful. # - build/download a local wheel so we don't hit the network on each venv. if [ -n "${PBR_PIP_VERSION:-}" ]; then td=$(mktemp -d) $tmpdir/wheelhouse/bin/pip wheel -w $td $PBR_PIP_VERSION # This version will now be installed in every new venv. export PIPVERSION="$td/$(ls $td)" $tmpdir/wheelhouse/bin/pip install -U $PIPVERSION # We have pip in global-requirements as open-ended requirements, # but since we don't use -U in any other invocations, our version # of pip should be sticky. fi # Build wheels of everything (that can) to make things faster. # pip will try everything, but exits non-zero if any one thing fails. $tmpdir/wheelhouse/bin/pip wheel -w $WHEELHOUSE -f $WHEELHOUSE -r \ $REPODIR/requirements/global-requirements.txt || true
deleted_lines: $venv/bin/pip install -U pip wheel pbr# Not all packages properly build wheels (httpretty for example). # Do our best but ignore errors when making wheels. set +e grep -v '^#' $REPODIR/requirements/global-requirements.txt | while read req do $tmpdir/wheelhouse/bin/pip wheel "$req" done set -e

commit_message:
Move trove into in-tree plugin

Once the trove code is copied into the trove repo and it is used
as a devstack-plugin, we can remove trove-specific code from
devstack.

Depends-On: I3506dec0e6097f9c2e9267110fdfb768faa23c85

commit_message:
Setup stubs for health manager and housekeeping

DevStack will error out during the install with the current
configuration.  This change puts stub services in place so that
DevStack will not error out during the install.

Change-Id: I4d053de933f5d6a576f09fc46e41cc305106ed29

Replace ci.o.o links with docs.o.o/infra

The http://ci.openstack.org/ documentation site has been deprecated,
replaced by redirects to corresponding paths within

documentation already resides.

commit_message:
LBaas v1 Associate Monitor to Pool Fails

The associate monitor fails to show monitors to choose from
within horizon.  The monitor list code has changed where
you can no longer list monitors with a filter criteria.
This change switches to grab needed monitors one at a time.

Change-Id: Ibc5233028507c66de459e84e91f65c9557940ea5
Closes-bug: #1398754

commit_message:
Fix for VBox "No Internet connection on compute nodes"

The scripts work without any firewall tuning on the user's computers.
The Fuel master node is forwarding the public network through
the existing NAT interface.

Change-Id: I2962bccb39828da4ff011889f990a67d89322ca3
Closes-Bug: #1288135

commit_message:
Use a depth of 2 in devref

Displaying items 3 levels deep in the devref index page just adds
clutter and very little useful information.

commit_message:
Consolidate API sections in docs

Instead of having a local v2 section and another section pointing to v2.1 and
v2 and v2 extensions (hosted by docs team), combine sections.

Change-Id: I792e2cf046302ecf5bcd6d5591af3d1ae5afad79
Note: Its still strange to have two separate sets of V2 documentation

commit_message:
Fix docs about configuring heat with devstack

Docs still tells that Heat is configured by default on
devstack. Need to fix it.

Change-Id: I186415f3422f3865aa3fbf4fe83ef13ea73c7eed
Closes-bug: #1450422
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/22/179022/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Heat is configured by default on devstack for Icehouse and Juno releases. Newer versions of OpenStack require next devstack configuring: 1. Download devstack_. 2. Heat are not enabled by default, so it must be enabled in `localrc` before running `stack.sh`. This is example of enabling all services required for heat:: [[local|localrc]] #Enable heat services enable_service h-eng h-api h-api-cfn h-api-cw .. _devstack: http://www.devstack.org/
deleted_lines: Heat is configured by default on devstack for Icehouse or newer versions of OpenStack.

commit_message:
Catch warnings consistently during tests

Use unittest2.assertWarnsRegex() for making sure we generate the
required warnings.
Use WarningsCapture to not print the other repeated warns to the
console.

Change-Id: I7223f8956394208eaf2eb8a1d651ba1425128bc9

commit_message:
VMware: remove suds tests

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/181554/ removed the
dependency on suds. This is tested in oslo.vmware. So there is no
need to test this here.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I9e98a31c9468927fd72b231043dcc464e2ba60b1

commit_message:
Require --force argument when removing an environment

Since removal of an environment is a dangerous operation
it is nececcary to ask user to enter an extra proof of the
intended action.

This patch adds the required --force argument to the env-delete
command.

Closes-bug: #1455025
Change-Id: I0aacf547c6c48755a8d3b9a139dc4f30d9d46a4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/12/183012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(EnvDelete, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument('-f', '--force', action='store_true', required=True, help='Force-delete the environment.') return parser

commit_message:
Configure the centos-rdo-base to use master/Kilo packages instead of rc2
from delorean.

Change-Id: Id4a90dc697175c0467552dedc54f9f693894b3a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/29/182829/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RUN yum install -y https://rdoproject.org/repos/openstack-kilo/rdo-release-kilo.rpm epel-release \ && sed -ri 's,(.+openstack-kilo)/epel-7(.*),\1/el7/\2,' /etc/yum.repos.d/rdo-release.repo \ && curl https://copr.fedoraproject.org/coprs/larsks/crux/repo/epel-7/larsks-crux-epel-7.repo -o /etc/yum.repos.d/larsks-crux-epel-7.repo \ && curl https://copr.fedoraproject.org/coprs/sdake/pam.noaudit/repo/epel-7/sdake-pam.noaudit-epel-7.repo -o /etc/yum.repos.d/sdake-pam.noaudit-epel-7.repo \ && rpm -e --nodeps systemd-container systemd-container-libs \ && rpm -e --nodeps yum-plugin-fastestmirror \ && yum update -y \ && yum install -y \ systemd \ systemd-libs \ systemd-devel \ && yum clean allRUN rpm -e --nodeps pam \ && yum -y install pam+noaudit \ && yum clean all

commit_message:
Don't raise error if actions are mismatched

Heat stack_resource has similar check for actions, but currently it does
not raise error if actions are different. OS::Heat::Stack resource is
similar on stack_resource so it has same issue, when resources require
some time to change state/action and it should not be so strict.

Change-Id: I20c2d3f8900b7393b1f551384805a35d5ef6497d
Closes-Bug: #1454589

commit_message:
Add basic Ceilometer alarm test

This sends a manual ceilometer sample to trigger the alarm,
then confirms that the autoscale policy/group reacts correctly.

Note: this doesn't used ScenarioBaseTest as it skips the test
unnecessarily on unused images and networks.

Change-Id: I5c842779d90497ba88df66bbfd8f447679645192
Depends-On: Ib3795bcca9d5ec3d68c6443a9854dbc56118ca40

commit_message:
Set mtu=65000 on patchcord br-floating/br-ex

We have to increase mtu for br-floating/br-ex patchcord because
otherwise we will have performance degradation if some VM use
non-default mtu.

Related-Bug: #1453425

Change-Id: I3b28c01d112b5951c62e35eeabe8f2f4fd67a475
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

Set appropriate MTU for Neutron agents

+ move MTU size calculation to level UP

Change-Id: I19726d635a16cfa30d8df099041cd76fb88a2de0
Closes-Bug: 1453425

commit_message:
Fixes for pcmk_nodes and crm_node

* Use crm_node -n to get node's hostname
* Check if node is in cluster in service provider
* implement pacemaker nodes add in pcmk_nodes
* compatibility between fqdn and hostname in pcmk_nodes
* fix new node id and number generation in pcmk_nodes

Change-Id: I2e40e25df975621506141dfe78efa884255f1642
Related-Bug: 1451795
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/69/180669/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands 'crm_node' => '/usr/sbin/crm_node' def node_name return @node_name if @node_name @node_name = crm_node('-n').chomp.strip end def pcmk_nodes_reset @corosync_nodes_structure = nil @node_name = nil end ### def change_fqdn_to_name? begin return false if nodes_data.keys.include? node_name return true if nodes_data.keys.map { |fqdn| fqdn.split('.').first }.include? node_name false rescue false end end def change_fqdn_to_name debug 'Changing Pacemaker node names from FQDNs to Hostnames' nodes = {} @resource[:nodes].each do |fqdn, ip| name = fqdn.split('.').first nodes.store name, ip end @resource[:nodes] = nodes @resource[:pacemaker_nodes] = @resource[:nodes].keys @resource[:corosync_nodes] = @resource[:nodes].keys pcmk_nodes_reset end ### def generate_new_node(node_name) return corosync_nodes_structure[node_name] if corosync_nodes_structure[node_name] ip = nodes_data[node_name] @corosync_nodes_structure[node_name] = { 'uanme' => node_name, 'id' => next_pacemaker_node_id, 'number' => next_corosync_node_number, 'ring0_addr' => ip, } @corosync_nodes_structure[node_name] end def next_corosync_node_number number = corosync_nodes_structure.inject(0) do |max, node| number += 1 number.to_s def next_pacemaker_node_id id = corosync_nodes_structure.inject(0) do |max, node| id = node.last['id'].to_i max = id if id > max id += 1 id.to_s def add_pacemaker_node(node_name) node_id = generate_new_node(node_name)['id'] add_pacemaker_node_record node_name, node_id add_pacemaker_node_state node_name, node_id end def add_pacemaker_node_record(node_name, node_id) patch = <<-eos <diff> <diff-added> <cib> <configuration> <nodes> <node id="#{node_id}" uname="#{node_name}" __crm_diff_marker__="added:top"/> </nodes> </configuration> </cib> </diff-added> </diff> eos cibadmin_safe '--patch', '--sync-call', '--xml-text', patch end def add_pacemaker_node_state(node_name, node_id) patch = <<-eos <diff> <diff-added> <cib> <status> <node_state id="#{node_id}" uname="#{node_name}" in_ccm="true" crmd="online" crm-debug-origin="do_update_resource" join="member" expected="member" __crm_diff_marker__="added:top"/> </status> </cib> </diff-added> </diff> eos cibadmin_safe '--patch', '--sync-call', '--xml-text', patch end node = generate_new_node node_name unless node['number'] and nodes_data[node_name] and node['id'] fail "Could not get all the data for the new node '#{node_name}' (#{node['number']}, #{nodes_data[node_name]}, #{node['id']})" add_corosync_node_record node['number'], nodes_data[node_name], node['id'] change_fqdn_to_name if change_fqdn_to_name? # remove unexpected nodes # add missing nodes change_fqdn_to_name if change_fqdn_to_name? # remove unexpected nodes # add missing nodes expected_nodes.each do |node| next if existing_nodes.include? node add_pacemaker_node node end
deleted_lines: def highest_corosync_node_number corosync_nodes_structure.inject(0) do |max, node| def highest_pacemaker_node_id pacemaker_nodes_structure.inject(0) do |max, node| number = node.last.to_i max = number if number > max node_number = highest_corosync_node_number + 1 node_addr = nodes_data[node_name] node_id = highest_pacemaker_node_id + 1 unless node_number and node_addr and node_id fail "Could not get all the data for the new node '#{node_name}' (#{node_number}, #{node_addr}, #{node_id})" add_corosync_node_record node_number, node_addr, node_id ##

subject: Uncap pytz and block pycadf 0.6.2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-13 16:48:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/ee53cc1e560fabcce63c4b9b850a90ab84b2c5b9', 'message': 'Add a note about the order of pycadf and Babel because of pytz

Change Id18916953f6e1bae3688216eaf809c2086b4af13 is failing the
stable/juno runs because Babel 1.3 is installed first which installs the
latest pytz (pytz is uncapped in Babel 1.3), but pytz is capped in
pycadf 0.6.2 (latest that will run under stable/juno g-r), so we hit a
ContextualVersionConflict.

Add a note in global-requirements.txt warning users about the order.

This is not a problem on master or stable/kilo because pytz is uncapped
there.

Change-Id: I3ca651a4377d61be3fed572355326bc180ad7eec
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-13 19:56:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/cc41409fdbbbad10b7d372dfc0e4d0c7ce7f804e', 'message': "Uncap pytz and add a note on ordering between Babel and pycadf

Change Id18916953f6e1bae3688216eaf809c2086b4af13 is failing the
stable/juno runs because Babel 1.3 is installed first which installs the
latest pytz (pytz is uncapped in Babel 1.3), but pytz is capped in
pycadf 0.6.2 (latest that will run under stable/juno g-r), so we hit a
ContextualVersionConflict.

Add a note in global-requirements.txt warning users about the order.

This is not a problem on master or stable/kilo because pytz is uncapped
there.

We uncap pytz here because (1) stable/icehouse has a completely opposite
supported version range for pytz in g-r which makes grenade sad and (2)
pytz does not have dependencies of it's own, it's a fairly simple
project so we don't have a transitive dependency risk here so uncapping
should be safe.

Change-Id: I3ca651a4377d61be3fed572355326bc180ad7eec
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-13 20:57:28.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/2abb500546e4b69fa482a58a5fbc6643129eb389', 'message': "Uncap pytz and block pycadf 0.6.2

Change-Id: I3ca651a4377d61be3fed572355326bc180ad7eec
"}]
commit_message:
Uncap pytz and block pycadf 0.6.2

Change Id18916953f6e1bae3688216eaf809c2086b4af13 is failing the
stable/juno runs because Babel 1.3 is installed first which installs the
latest pytz (pytz is uncapped in Babel 1.3), but pytz is capped in
pycadf 0.6.2 (latest that will run under stable/juno g-r), so we hit a
ContextualVersionConflict.

This is not a problem on master or stable/kilo because pytz is uncapped
there.

We uncap pytz here because (1) stable/icehouse has a completely opposite
supported version range for pytz in g-r which makes grenade sad and (2)
pytz does not have dependencies of it's own, it's a fairly simple
project so we don't have a transitive dependency risk here so uncapping
should be safe.

We block pycadf 0.6.2 because it has the previously set cap on pytz.

Change-Id: I3ca651a4377d61be3fed572355326bc180ad7eec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/55/182755/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mriedem): pycadf must come before Babel in a project's requirements.txt # because Babel 1.3 requires uncapped pytz which can conflict with the capped # version of pytz in stable versions of pycadf.

subject: Common head method for proxies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-14 19:15:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/0338aa0d4a884f499338e9d529389bd0a1e6a75c', 'message': 'Common head method for proxies

This change adds a common HEAD method for proxy methods to use. It
currently supports calling HEAD directly on a resource (which is done in
at least one place, to get account metadata in object_store), as well as
the likely more common case of requesting HEAD for a particular resource
via the `value` parameter (such as getting container or object
metadata).

Change-Id: Icec939d40c6028c245c9503cbdfecfa801c265ef
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-14 20:42:28.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/object_store/v1/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/proxy.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_proxy_base.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/_proxy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/ba524a34e447cbc656d16f22f515b530fb6ad2b2', 'message': 'Common head method for proxies

This change adds a common HEAD method for proxy methods to use. It
currently supports calling HEAD directly on a resource (which is done in
at least one place, to get account metadata in object_store), as well as
the likely more common case of requesting HEAD for a particular resource
via the `value` parameter (such as getting container or object
metadata).

Change-Id: Icec939d40c6028c245c9503cbdfecfa801c265ef
'}]
commit_message:
Common head method for proxies

This change adds a common HEAD method for proxy methods to use. It
currently supports calling HEAD directly on a resource (which is done in
at least one place, to get account metadata in object_store), as well as
the likely more common case of requesting HEAD for a particular resource
via the `value` parameter (such as getting container or object
metadata).

Change-Id: Icec939d40c6028c245c9503cbdfecfa801c265ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/83/183183/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Get metatdata for this account return self._head(_container.Container) def get_container_metadata(self, value): """Get metatdata for a container :param value: The value can be the name of a container or a :class:`~openstack.object_store.v1.container.Container` instance. :returns: One :class:`~openstack.object_store.v1.container.Container` :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceNotFound` when no resource can be found for this name or id. return self._head(_container.Container, value) def get_object_metadata(self, value): """Get metatdata for an object :param value: The value is an :class:`~openstack.object_store.v1.obj.Object` instance. :returns: One :class:`~openstack.object_store.v1.obj.Object` :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceNotFound` when no resource can be found for this name or id. # TODO(brian): Currently this requires that you pass in only an # Object instance, not a name like other places. We should explore # expanding this to support taking container and name. self._head(_obj.Object, value)
deleted_lines: """Get metatdata for this account. return _container.Container().head(self.session) def get_container_metadata(self, container): """Get metatdata for a container. :param container: The container to retreive metadata for. You can pass a container object or the name of a container to retrieve metadata for. :type container: :class:`~openstack.object_store.v1.container.Container` :rtype: :class:`~openstack.object_store.v1.container.Container` :raises: :exc:`ValueError` when an unnamed container object was specified, as this would instead retrieve account metadata. container = _container.Container.from_id(container) if getattr(container, "name") is None: msg = "A named container or a name itself must be passed" raise ValueError(msg) return container.head(self.session) def get_object_metadata(self, obj): """Get metatdata for an object. :param obj: The object to retreive metadata from. :type obj: :class:`~openstack.object_store.v1.obj.Object` :return: A :class:`~openstack.object_store.v1.obj.Object` populated with the server's response. return obj.head(self.session)

commit_message:
copy artifacts from base tempest to target

Instead of recreating the tox and testrepository environments from
scratch, copy the contents of the base runs into the target
runs. Tempest tox creation takes about 2 minutes, so this should drop
2 minutes from all the grenade runs.

Change-Id: I4dfc33183ab69c4984a0d5bd234a4b767ee68228
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/51/178651/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # once we are done, copy our created artifacts to the target if [[ -e $TARGET_RELEASE_DIR/tempest ]]; then for file in .tox .testrepository; do rsync -avP $BASE_RELEASE_DIR/tempest/$file/ $TARGET_RELEASE_DIR/tempest/$file/ done fi

commit_message:
LIO: Enable iSER for IPv6

Commit
  ffdfd0f Support iSER driver within the ISCSITarget flow
introduced support for iSER with LIO, but it only enables
iSER for the IPv4 portal.  If we created an IPv6 portal,
enable it there as well.

Change-Id: I1684bba6fc2b775acdee70b6ad0fc0568aaebeac

commit_message:
pass credentials via config file instead of magic

Passing credentials via an assumed environment inheritance is bad
form, and breaks under new tox. Honestly, we only really need 2 vars
passed in, so we might as well make it a config file that we'll parse.

Add a functional_creds.conf.sample for people to know what one should
look like. Update README to explain it.

Related-Bug: #1455102

Change-Id: Ifdab38a03c94f51d30449149c0dbd9c6265460a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/07/183007/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

WIP - Implement unit tests for API services

Applying unit tests for various API services.

NOTE: This is very much in progress at this point, experimenting with
different approaches and comparing.

Change-Id: I5ada7b1a77932bb9aa218479e49f829fac07392e

added_lines: /* * (c) Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. * You may obtain a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and * limitations under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; describe('Security Groups API', function() { var service, apiService; beforeEach(module('hz.api')); beforeEach(module(function($provide) { apiService = { get: angular.noop }; $provide.value('apiService', apiService); })); beforeEach(inject(function(securityGroup) { service = securityGroup; })); it('defines the security group service', function() { expect(service).toBeDefined(); }); it('calls the apiService with the appropriate get', function() { spyOn(apiService, 'get').and.returnValue({error: angular.noop}); service.query(); expect(apiService.get).toHaveBeenCalledWith('/api/network/securitygroups/'); }); it('calls the error path when an error', function() { var errObj = {error: angular.noop}; spyOn(apiService, 'get').and.returnValue(errObj); spyOn(errObj, 'error'); service.query(); expect(apiService.get).toHaveBeenCalledWith('/api/network/securitygroups/'); var innerFunc = errObj.error.calls.argsFor(0)[0]; expect(innerFunc).toBeDefined(); horizon = {alert: angular.noop}; spyOn(horizon, 'alert'); innerFunc(); expect(horizon.alert).toHaveBeenCalledWith('error', 'Unable to retrieve security groups.'); }); }); })();

commit_message:
Pick up new plugins for ELK

Add to the lookup list 6 new classes to handle the new translation:
ToscaRsyslog, ToscaCollectd, ToscaLogstash, ToscaKibana,
ToscaElasticsearch, ToscaPaypalPizzaStore
This set should complete the monitoring use case

Partially Implements: blueprint translate-tosca-monitoring-usecase
Change-Id: Ia8e9efd69a213014508bd495253ea26a708b2a16

commit_message:
Add image building verification to gate for Kolla

The setup_docker script downloads and starts the Docker binary while
the tox run performs the actual test of verifying all the Dockerfiles
in the project successfully builds or fails as expected.

Change-Id: I4d05c32a2faa30f0b15487dfd605089f61baf985
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/27/182927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'tox -e setupenv' 'tox -e images'

commit_message:
Ironic conductor requires ipmitool command

Need to install the ipmitool package for conductor. Also
no need to notify or subscribe immediate for package
updates, that just causes the service to restart several times
when the all the packages have not yet been installed.

Change-Id: Ie5d33224f71e154ac904dcb0568ab2970e1f1647
Closes-Bug: #1454770
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-bare-metal refs/changes/47/182747/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %w(ironic-conductor shellinabox ipmitool).each do |pkg|

commit_message:
Fixed post_network_plug issues

If there was no interface to raise, it would insert bad data into
the interfaces file.  Also, execute ifdown first before ifup for
sanity that prevents some inconsistent successes and failures.

Change-Id: I96d552e0f46ebbdfd9827b9b9c818e5c561699b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/75/182875/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if output: # make interface come up on boot command = ("sudo sh -c 'echo \"\nauto {0}\niface {0} inet dhcp\" " ">> /etc/network/interfaces'".format(output)) stdin, stdout, stderr = self.client.exec_command(command) LOG.debug('Sent command {0}'.format(command)) LOG.debug('Returned stdout: {0}'.format(stdout.read())) LOG.debug('Returned stderr: {0}'.format(stderr.read())) # ifdown for sanity command = "sudo ifdown {0}".format(output) stdin, stdout, stderr = self.client.exec_command(command) LOG.debug('Sent command {0}'.format(command)) LOG.debug('Returned stdout: {0}'.format(stdout.read())) LOG.debug('Returned stderr: {0}'.format(stderr.read())) # ifup to bring it up command = "sudo ifup {0}".format(output) stdin, stdout, stderr = self.client.exec_command(command) LOG.debug('Sent command {0}'.format(command)) LOG.debug('Returned stdout: {0}'.format(stdout.read())) LOG.debug('Returned stderr: {0}'.format(stderr.read()))
deleted_lines: command = ("sudo sh -c 'echo \"\nauto {0}\niface {0} inet dhcp\" " ">> /etc/network/interfaces; ifup {0}'".format(output)) self.client.exec_command(command)

commit_message:
go: clean up and add to obj tests

Add a few object server tests and clean up the existing ones.
Still a lot more tests needed.

Change-Id: Ib13dc096a0e7f08b611e5997e21cbc716fd08379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/65/182065/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "io" "path/filepath" "strings"type TestServer struct { *httptest.Server host string port int root string } func (t *TestServer) Close() { os.RemoveAll(t.root) t.Server.Close() } func (t *TestServer) Do(method string, path string, body io.ReadCloser) (*http.Response, error) { req, err := http.NewRequest(method, fmt.Sprintf("http://%s:%d%s", t.host, t.port, path), body) if err != nil { return nil, err } return http.DefaultClient.Do(req) } func makeObjectServer(settings ...string) (*TestServer, error) { driveRoot, err := ioutil.TempDir("", "") if err != nil { return nil, err } conf, err := ioutil.TempFile(driveRoot, "") if err != nil { return nil, err } fmt.Fprintf(conf, "devices=%s\n", driveRoot) fmt.Fprintf(conf, "mount_check=false\n") if err := conf.Close(); err != nil { return nil, err } ts := httptest.NewServer(handler) u, err := url.Parse(ts.URL) if err != nil { return nil, err } host, ports, err := net.SplitHostPort(u.Host) if err != nil { return nil, err } port, err := strconv.Atoi(ports) if err != nil { return nil, err } return &TestServer{Server: ts, host: host, port: port, root: driveRoot}, nil ts, err := makeObjectServer() assert.Nil(t, err) url := fmt.Sprintf("http://%s:%d/sda/objects/1/fff/ffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff/1425753549.77564.data", ts.host, ts.port) resp, err := http.DefaultClient.Do(req) assert.True(t, err := makeObjectServer() assert.Nil(t, err) defer ts.Close() timestamp := hummingbird.GetTimestamp() req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", fmt.Sprintf("http://%s:%d/sda/0/a/c/o", ts.host, ts.port), bytes.NewBuffer([]byte("SOME DATA"))) assert.Nil(t, err) req.Header.Set("Content-Type", "application/octet-stream") req.Header.Set("Content-Length", "9") req.Header.Set("X-Timestamp", timestamp) resp, err := http.DefaultClient.Do(req) assert.Nil(t, err) assert.Equal(t, 201, resp.StatusCode) resp, err = ts.Do("GET", "/sda/0/a/c/o", nil) assert.Nil(t, err) assert.Equal(t, 200, resp.StatusCode) assert.Equal(t, timestamp, resp.Header.Get("X-Timestamp")) assert.Equal(t, "9", resp.Header.Get("Content-Length")) } func TestBasicPutDelete(t *testing.T) { ts, err := makeObjectServer() assert.Nil(t, err) defer ts.Close() timestamp := hummingbird.GetTimestamp() req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", fmt.Sprintf("http://%s:%d/sda/0/a/c/o", ts.host, ts.port), bytes.NewBuffer([]byte("SOME DATA"))) assert.Nil(t, err) req.Header.Set("Content-Type", "application/octet-stream") req.Header.Set("Content-Length", "9") req.Header.Set("X-Timestamp", timestamp) resp, err := http.DefaultClient.Do(req) assert.Nil(t, err) assert.Equal(t, 201, resp.StatusCode) timestamp = hummingbird.GetTimestamp() req, err = http.NewRequest("DELETE", fmt.Sprintf("http://%s:%d/sda/0/a/c/o", ts.host, ts.port), nil) assert.Nil(t, err) req.Header.Set("X-Timestamp", timestamp) resp, err = http.DefaultClient.Do(req) assert.Nil(t, err) assert.Equal(t, 204, resp.StatusCode) resp, err = ts.Do("GET", "/sda/0/a/c/o", nil) assert.Nil(t, err) assert.Equal(t, 404, resp.StatusCode) } func TestGetRanges(t *testing.T) { ts, err := makeObjectServer() assert.Nil(t, err) defer ts.Close() req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", fmt.Sprintf("http://%s:%d/sda/0/a/c/o", ts.host, ts.port), bytes.NewBuffer([]byte("ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"))) assert.Nil(t, err) req.Header.Set("Content-Type", "application/octet-stream") req.Header.Set("Content-Length", "26") req.Header.Set("X-Timestamp", hummingbird.GetTimestamp()) resp, err := http.DefaultClient.Do(req) assert.Nil(t, err) assert.Equal(t, 201, resp.StatusCode) getRanges := func(ranges string) (*http.Response, []byte) { req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", fmt.Sprintf("http://%s:%d/sda/0/a/c/o", ts.host, ts.port), nil) assert.Nil(t, err) req.Header.Set("Range", ranges) resp, err := http.DefaultClient.Do(req) assert.Nil(t, err) body, err := ioutil.ReadAll(resp.Body) assert.Nil(t, err) return resp, body } resp, body := getRanges("bytes=0-5") assert.Equal(t, http.StatusPartialContent, resp.StatusCode) assert.Equal(t, "ABCDEF", string(body)) resp, body = getRanges("bytes=20-") assert.Equal(t, http.StatusPartialContent, resp.StatusCode) assert.Equal(t, "UVWXYZ", string(body)) resp, body = getRanges("bytes=-6") assert.Equal(t, http.StatusPartialContent, resp.StatusCode) assert.Equal(t, "UVWXYZ", string(body)) resp, body = getRanges("bytes=27-28") assert.Equal(t, http.StatusRequestedRangeNotSatisfiable, resp.StatusCode) resp, body = getRanges("bytes=20-,-6") assert.Equal(t, http.StatusPartialContent, resp.StatusCode) assert.True(t, strings.HasPrefix(resp.Header.Get("Content-Type"), "multipart/byteranges;boundary=")) assert.Equal(t, "356", resp.Header.Get("Content-Length")) assert.Equal(t, 2, strings.Count(string(body), "UVWXYZ")) }

commit_message:
Do checkout of the code when preparing repo target

If GERRIT_BRANCH is defined, checkout fetch_head
instead of cherry-picking it.

Closes-bug: #1455156
partial blueprint: package-fuel-components

Change-Id: I6f57bd3a930842bdcc6f313fde04ee98cba7b01a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/09/183109/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ifeq ($(strip $(GERRIT_BRANCH)),) #FIXME(aglarendil): THIS IS A TEMPORARY FIX TO CHECK OUT CODE FOR PACKAGE BUILDING IN CI #IT SHOULD BE REPLACED WITH ANOTHER APPROACH SOON else ( cd $(BUILD_DIR)/repos/$1 && git fetch $4 $5 && git checkout FETCH_HEAD ) ; endif

commit_message:
Fixes issue with non-unicode ip addresses in wsme

Some update happened (not exactly sure where) that stopped converting
strings to unicode to validate ip addresses.

Change-Id: Ibccc32be24a5e93e0ee3186d171f2ac0f0fcb40e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/74/183174/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: wtypes.IPv4AddressType.validate(unicode(value)) wtypes.IPv6AddressType.validate(unicode(value))

Add stable/kilo, stable/juno, and stable/icehouse to Kolla
IRC notifications.

commit_message:
VMware: remove invalid comment

Commit cd1765459a24e52e1b933c8e05517fed75ac9d41 removed maintaining
an addition VM for a rescue operation. The comment deleted is no
longer relevant.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic359dee75acb58792742ced86cc9af1ee3564ae3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/182839/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Common list method for proxies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 17:31:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/c8e43d48d892125a259847024404c651e6dafa2f', 'message': "Common list method for proxies

This change introduces a common list method for proxies, enabling the
use of query parameters to be used in limiting the data returned by a
request. In accepting query parameters, it also handles accepting
parameters that are resources by converting the resource into the
appropriate ID, so you can, e.g., get all servers that are running with
a particular image via that image's resource instance.

The Proxy._list method accept query parameters as keyword arguments that
are passed on to Resource.list, which are then passed on to
Resource.page, which are then passed on to session.get via the params=
parameters, which then causes the requests library to append those
key/value pairs onto the request URL as query parameters. From each
proxy's use of this common class, the approach was taken to accept the
query parameters in, e.g., compute.servers, as keyword arguments rather
than explicit parameters. This was done as there are a large amount of
parameters accepted by not just the /servers resource, but by many
others around other services.

As with other common methods for proxies, this change applies the base
method to the servers method (formerly known as list_servers).
Additionally, this method accepting query parameters to limit responses
will work in conjunction with the `get` methods with the aim of
converging the get/list/find set of methods to just get/list.

As with other changes like this, it introduces a second test
verification method that duplicates an existing one since we'll have two
APIs temporarily, but that will be removed once we've converged on this
API for listing.

Change-Id: I5e6d62a649a9f492433ea76d6eeaa754884e40ec

APIs temporarily, but that will be removed once we've converged on this
API for listing.

Change-Id: I5e6d62a649a9f492433ea76d6eeaa754884e40ec

commit_message:
Common list method for proxies

This change introduces a common list method for proxies, enabling the
use of query parameters to be used in limiting the data returned by a
request. In accepting query parameters, it also handles accepting
parameters that are resources by converting the resource into the
appropriate ID, so you can, e.g., get all servers that are running with
a particular image via that image's resource instance.

The Proxy._list method accept query parameters as keyword arguments that
are passed on to Resource.list, which are then passed on to
Resource.page, which are then passed on to session.get via the params=
parameters, which then causes the requests library to append those
key/value pairs onto the request URL as query parameters. From each
proxy's use of this common class, the approach was taken to accept the
query parameters in, e.g., compute.servers, as keyword arguments rather
than explicit parameters. This was done as there are a large amount of
parameters accepted by not just the /servers resource, but by many
others around other services.

As with other common methods for proxies, this change applies the base
method to the servers method (formerly known as list_servers).
Additionally, this method accepting query parameters to limit responses
will work in conjunction with the `get` methods with the aim of
converging the get/list/find set of methods to just get/list.

As with other changes like this, it introduces a second test
verification method that duplicates an existing one since we'll have two
APIs temporarily, but that will be removed once we've converged on this
API for listing.

Change-Id: I5e6d62a649a9f492433ea76d6eeaa754884e40ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/02/178302/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def servers(self, details=True, **params): """Retrieve a generator of servers :param bool details: When set to ``False`` :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Server` instances will be returned. The default, ``True``, will cause :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.ServerDetail` instances to be returned. :param dict **params: Optional query parameters to be sent to limit the servers being returned. Available parameters include: * changes_since: A time/date stamp for when the server last changed status. * image: The image. * flavor: The specific flavor, which is a combination of memory, disk size, and CPUs. * name: Name of the server as a string. Can be queried with regular expressions. The regular expression ?name=bob returns both bob and bobb. If you must match on only bob, you can use a regular expression that matches the syntax of the underlying database server that is implemented for Compute, such as MySQL or PostgreSQL. * status: Value of the status of the server so that you can filter on "ACTIVE" for example. * host: Name of the host as a string. * limit: Requests a specified page size of returned items from the query. Returns a number of items up to the specified limit value. Use the limit parameter to make an initial limited request and use the ID of the last-seen item from the response as the marker parameter value in a subsequent limited request. * marker: Specifies the ID of the last-seen item. Use the limit parameter to make an initial limited request and use the ID of the last-seen item from the response as the marker parameter value in a subsequent limited request. :returns: A generator of server instances. """ # Server expects changes-since, but we use an underscore # so it can be a proper Python name. if "changes_since" in params: val = params.pop("changes_since") params["changes-since"] = val return self._list(srv, paginated=True, **params)
deleted_lines: def list_servers(self, details=True): return srv.list(self.session, paginated=True)

commit_message:
devstack: Add multi-node support

Instead of having a single "ovn" service that can be enabled, this
patch makes it so you can enable "ovn-controller" and "ovn-northd"
separately.  This is important for multi-node devstack testing, as you
only want to run ovn-controller on a compute node.  Documentation and
sample configuration has been updated to reflect how to use these
updates.

This patch also adds two new devstack config variables: OVN_REMOTE and
OVN_UUID.

The default for OVN_REMOTE should be fine except on hosts where
ovn-controller is enabled.  In that case, it should be set such that
the host knows to talk to the proper host running ovsdb-server with
the OVN databases (the one running ovn-northd).

OVN_UUID is optional.  Normally a random UUID is generated (and saved
for re-use), but it can be specified if you desire to use a specific
one for some reason.

Change-Id: Iaf040fe17b26c9b7d0b61daa0bec1b3acbee3806
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/02/181502/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The OVN role for this host. # full - The default. In this role, the host will run ovn-northd, # ovsdb-server with the OVN databases, and ovn-controller. # This would be used with a typical single-node devstack # environment. # northd - Run ovn-northd and ovsdb-server with the OVN databases. # controller - Run ovn-controller. Connect to ovsdb-server running OVN # databases at OVN_REMOTE. OVN_ROLE=${OVN_ROLE:-full} # How to connect to ovsdb-server hosting the OVN databases. OVN_REMOTE=${OVN_REMOTE:-tcp:$SERVICE_HOST:6640} # Utility Functions # ----------------- function ovn_role { role=$1 if [ "$OVN_ROLE" = "full" ] || [ "$OVN_ROLE" = "$role" ] ; then return 0 else return 1 fi } NEUTRON_CONF=/etc/neutron/neutron.conf iniset $NEUTRON_CONF ovn ovsdb_connection "$OVN_REMOTE" for db in conf.db ovnsb.db ovnnb.db ; do if ovn_role northd ; then ovsdb-tool create $base_dir/ovnsb.db $DEST/$OVN_REPO_NAME/ovn/ovn-sb.ovsschema ovsdb-tool create $base_dir/ovnnb.db $DEST/$OVN_REPO_NAME/ovn/ovn-nb.ovsschema fi EXTRA_DBS="" OVSDB_REMOTE="" if ovn_role northd ; then EXTRA_DBS="ovnsb.db ovnnb.db" fi if ovn_role controller ; then OVSDB_REMOTE="--remote=ptcp:6640:$SERVICE_HOST" fi --pidfile --detach -vconsole:off --log-file $OVSDB_REMOTE \ conf.db ${EXTRA_DBS} if ovn_role controller ; then ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:ovn-remote="$OVN_REMOTE" ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:ovn-bridge="br-int" ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:ovn-encap-type="geneve" ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:ovn-encap-ip="$SERVICE_HOST" sudo ovs-vswitchd --pidfile --detach -vconsole:off --log-file sudo ovn-controller --pidfile --detach -vconsole:off --log-file \ unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/db.sock _neutron_ovs_base_setup_bridge $OVS_BRIDGE ovs-vsctl set bridge br-int fail-mode=secure other-config:disable-in-band=true fi if ovn_role northd ; then ovn-northd --pidfile --detach -vconsole:off --log-file fi
deleted_lines: for db in conf.db ovn.db ovnnb.db ; do ovsdb-tool create $base_dir/ovn.db $DEST/$OVN_REPO_NAME/ovn/ovn-sb.ovsschema ovsdb-tool create $base_dir/ovnnb.db $DEST/$OVN_REPO_NAME/ovn/ovn-nb.ovsschema --remote=ptcp:6640:127.0.0.1 \ --pidfile --detach -vconsole:off --log-file \ conf.db ovn.db ovnnb.db ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:ovn-remote="tcp:127.0.0.1:6640" ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:ovn-bridge="br-int" ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:ovn-encap-type="geneve" ovs-vsctl --no-wait set open_vswitch . external-ids:ovn-encap-ip="$SERVICE_HOST" sudo ovs-vswitchd --pidfile --detach -vconsole:off --log-file ovn-northd --pidfile --detach -vconsole:off --log-file sudo ovn-controller --pidfile --detach -vconsole:off --log-file \ unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/db.sock _neutron_ovs_base_setup_bridge $OVS_BRIDGE ovs-vsctl set bridge br-int fail-mode=secure other-config:disable-in-band=true

commit_message:
Rename Job Executions to Jobs in Jobs page

We rename the title of Jobs page into "Jobs" instead of old "Job
Executions" to avoid user confusion.

Close-Bug: #1454966
Change-Id: I3b89206236534e38db5748dccb7de4567649973d

commit_message:
Wrap all DHCP provider load errors

Currently DHCPFactory class wraps only RuntimeError into DHCPNotFound
exception during provider loading, all the other exceptions (like
import errors, for example) are not being handled.

This change introduces DHCPLoadError instead of DHCPNotFound, which
includes reason of error.

Change-Id: Ie9d01609f3e5fe255f8595eadc369a5078027160

Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for security_group_default_rule_create

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
security_group_default_rule_create.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

commit_message:
Rename functional test module from shares to shares_listing

Rename module with read-only functional tests named "shares" to
"shares_listing", because it best describes tests used there.
Also, module named "shares" will be used for basic share operations like
'create' and 'delete'.

Change-Id: I1cd7e202a815703bff7af98dd662ed900808de16

commit_message:
Increase quota for share networks in manila installation

Functional tests create a lot of share networks and may cause exceedance of
default limit. So, increase it, to be able to run tests not restricting
amount of threads.

commit_message:
Beef up docs on the logbook/flow detail/atom details models

Make it easier to understand what these objects do and what
the methods on those objects perform and return (and the limitations
certain methods have).

Also fixes one more instance of copying users results (where
on task detail merge the incoming task details results attribute
was copied into the current objects). This has the same problem
as mentioned in bug 1452978.

Change-Id: I265f06ccea751a70ee428e8a690805a5037a5a9d

commit_message:
Modify ordering of interface restarts.

When os-net-config is configured with a VLAN on top of a bond, this
leads to a race condition. The VLAN is started before the bond, so
when os-net-config tries to bring up the VLAN it will fail. This
change creates separate dicts for bonds and vlans. This change also
modifies the ifdown/ifup logic so that bridges are started, then bonds,
then interfaces, and finally VLANs. This change also adds the OVS_BRIDGE=
value to the ifcfg file for the bond, which helps to ensure the bond will
activate when ifup is run.

The latest patchset was rebased on top of the change to enable setting
the DEFROUTE=no in ifcfg files. I also noticed that in 4 places in
impl_ifcfg.py we were missing an else: so that the log messages saying
"No changes required.." were only shown when changes were required.
This patchset fixes those 4 logic errors.

Change-Id: I26ba1358ffbd40aec429a3df29702017a8a14afb
Closes-Bug: #1453904

commit_message:
Fix task require for modular Sahara

The problem is that sahara class called early than openstack-network-controller.
But Sahara creates templates, which require Neutron. As a result, Neutron
doesn't installed and neutronclient gave 503 error response.

Change-Id: I951894b5610dbe339db6cf5dcb62da34535a65ef
Closes-bug: #1455085

commit_message:
[WIP] Just a test if requirements job is running

The requirements job is only run if:
one of these files is changed as part of a patch:
      - '^tools/.*-requires$'
      - '^.*requirements.txt$'
      - '^.*requirements-py[2,3].txt$'

Change-Id: Icf1b5335c3f3d20a5cc8421fa2bc7a901398d396

subject: Use mkdtemp for mounting virtual media device
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-05 02:03:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/8f0c3caecdb01e4570fbcf258ea1642eefff264e', 'message': "Use mkdtemp for mounting virtual media device

When using virtual media, restarting ironic-python-agent
leads to errors like 'File exists'.  This is because
we use static directory (/vmedia_mnt) as mount path
and we don't remove it. It's better to use mkdtemp to create
a temporary directory for mounting virtual media
device.

leads to errors like 'File exists'.  This is because
we use static directory (/vmedia_mnt) as mount path
and we don't remove it. It's better to use mkdtemp to create
a temporary directory for mounting virtual media
device.

Change-Id: Ibb4c3d3a2024cf51ef198bd396fb9e86ad72a320
"}]
commit_message:
Use mkdtemp for mounting virtual media device

When using virtual media, restarting ironic-python-agent
leads to errors like 'File exists'.  This is because
we use static directory (/vmedia_mnt) as mount path
and we don't remove it. It's better to use mkdtemp to create
a temporary directory for mounting virtual media
device.

Change-Id: Ibb4c3d3a2024cf51ef198bd396fb9e86ad72a320
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/01/180001/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import tempfile import shutil vmedia_mount_point = tempfile.mkdtemp() try: try: stdout, stderr = execute("mount", vmedia_device_file, vmedia_mount_point) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: msg = ("Unable to mount virtual media device %(device)s: " "%(error)s" % {'device': vmedia_device_file, 'error': e}) raise errors.VirtualMediaBootError(msg) parameters_file_path = os.path.join(vmedia_mount_point, parameters_file) params = _read_params_from_file(parameters_file_path) try: stdout, stderr = execute("umount", vmedia_mount_point) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: pass finally: try: shutil.rmtree(vmedia_mount_point) except Exception as e: pass
deleted_lines: vmedia_mount_point = "/vmedia_mnt" os.mkdir(vmedia_mount_point) try: stdout, stderr = execute("mount", vmedia_device_file, vmedia_mount_point) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: msg = ("Unable to mount virtual media device %(device)s: %(error)s" % {'device': vmedia_device_file, 'error': e}) raise errors.VirtualMediaBootError(msg) parameters_file_path = os.path.join(vmedia_mount_point, parameters_file) params = _read_params_from_file(parameters_file_path) try: stdout, stderr = execute("umount", vmedia_mount_point) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: pass

commit_message:
Fixes Nova NoVNC

Previously, vnc was not completely working properly because
nova.conf config flags were not properly implemented in t he correct
containers.

This patch moves the nova.conf config flags for vnc to the proper
containers. Additionally, the patch modifies the proxy client ip
param to be consistent with the param within nova.conf and adds
all the novnc params to docs.

Change-Id: I1944baca64ccd113bbca582784b08f90dc0eff69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/21/182421/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: check_required_vars NOVA_NOVNC_PROXYCLIENT_IP# As such, PROXYCLIENT_IP is unique per compute node.crudini --set $cfg DEFAULT vncserver_proxyclient_address "${NOVA_NOVNC_PROXYCLIENT_IP}"

commit_message:
Add diskimage-builder/bin to PATH.

This is required because some tooling (build-images) calls out
to disk-image-create which needs to be in the PATH.

Change-Id: I6ad2357d68cd87764d78a723eaecbd487b5a98c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/98/177198/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export PATH=$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-incubator/scripts:$TRIPLEO_ROOT/dib-utils/bin:$TRIPLEO_ROOT/diskimage-builder/bin:$PATH

commit_message:
Fix the problem with port absence in config files

If port is without if_type it is assumed that it is ethernet
for Red Hat based distros. It is not used For Debian based at all.

Change-Id: I7879afac4a6fa9181d6375fc896489e93067356d
Closes-bug: #1454607

commit_message:
Perform cleanup before starting net_probe.py

If net_probe.py fails for unknown reason,
daemon process will hang there forever and next
net_probe.py run will fail with socket.bind error

Change-Id: I1f5889d59dc60aa374fdf3f9dd8e3e5e7c0a115b
Closes-Bug: #1259935
(cherry picked from commit d4edf32197c59495fd48662ede67f3751ee15d9b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/14/103014/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cleanup_netprobe def cleanup_netprobe status = run("pkill net_probe.py && sleep 2 && pgrep net_probe.py") reply.fail! "Cant stop net_probe.py execution." unless status == 1 end

commit_message:
Updated ldap config to support multi domain

Enables default domain support using ldap. This change moves the
ldap config to the default domain and enables domain specific
drivers.

Change-Id: I85f6610a25617fdea1fc216b53df0ab30260fed9
Cloes-Bug: 1447768
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/10/178310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: keystone_ldap_identity_driver: keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity keystone_ldap_domain_config_dir: /etc/keystone/domains

commit_message:
devstack: Don't force enable key,mysql,rabbit

These settings were a workaround for a bug in our jenkins job config.
The fix has been merged so remove this.  There are multi-node
configurations where we do not want these enabled.

Change-Id: I418516780cce150b83ed0a55f9d3308591307ee2

commit_message:
drop ovn.filters

The rootwrap filter was needed to let this code run ovn-nbctl, but
that command is no longer used, so we can drop the rootwrap filter, as
well.

Change-Id: Ie79c4206cb8fd97f4012c9f02590af54934380c7

Murano package definition and the glance image that it depends on.

subject: Erase non-root disks first
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-30 17:27:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute/commit/39b2b8fd33e3b422925e4a40485b2131c2dbdc87', 'message': 'Erase non-root disks first

This change adjusts the order that the system block devices (disks)
are erased as part erase_node MCollective action.  This change queries
the block devices for the system and uses lsblk to determine if the
device has a partition that is currently being used for mounting /.
The disks that are not used for / are erased first, followed by
the root disks.  This done to ensure that data disks are properly
cleaned up and are not accidentally left intact on the chance that
purging the root disk causes the erase script to fail.

Change-Id: I17e0e88224ef781b666b100f80904e5abfecd023
Closes-Bug: 1437511
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-12 21:29:07.000000000', 'files': ['mcagents/erase_node.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute/commit/53aee4a49102a14213631148ce861515fefb3f03', 'message': 'Erase non-root disks first

This change adjusts the order that the system block devices (disks)
are erased as part erase_node MCollective action.  This change queries
the block devices for the system and uses lsblk to determine if the
device has a partition that is currently being used for mounting /.
The disks that are not used for / are erased first, followed by
the root disks.  This done to ensure that data disks are properly
cleaned up and are not accidentally left intact on the chance that
purging the root disk causes the erase script to fail.

Change-Id: I17e0e88224ef781b666b100f80904e5abfecd023
