commit_message:
nailgun: GET and PUT support for RAID API handler

 - Implement data model to store RAID configuration for a
   node
 - Implement API handlers to get and update RAID configuration
   for a node

This change modifies the database schema and the migration, so it
requires to run syncdb.

Change-Id: I995a31b04c14fb7f7e02306598ef7a5703e6d285
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/33/101533/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get(self, node_id): resp = self.app.get( reverse('NodeRaidHandler', kwargs={'node_id': node_id}), headers=self.default_headers) self.assertEquals(200, resp.status_code) return json.loads(resp.body) def put(self, node_id, data, expect_errors=False): resp = self.app.put( reverse('NodeRaidHandler', kwargs={'node_id': node_id}), json.dumps(data), headers=self.default_headers, expect_errors=expect_errors) if not expect_errors: self.assertEquals(200, resp.status_code) return json.loads(resp.body) else: return resp def test_get_handler_with_wrong_nodeid(self): resp = self.app.get( reverse('NodeRaidHandler', kwargs={'node_id': 1}), expect_errors=True, headers=self.default_headers) self.assertEqual(resp.status_code, 404) def test_get_handler(self): node = self.env.create_node(api=True) resp = self.get(node["id"]) self.assertEqual(resp, {}) def test_put_handler(self): raid_config = {"raids": {"controllers": [{"name": "test"}]}} node_db = self.env.create_node() self.put(node_db.id, raid_config) resp = self.get(node_db.id) self.assertEqual(resp["raids"]["controllers"][0]["name"], "test")
deleted_lines: def test_get_handler(self): resp = self.app.get(reverse('NodeRaidHandler', kwargs={'node_id': 1}), expect_errors=True, headers=self.default_headers) self.assertEquals(resp.status_code, 200)

commit_message:
Add task manager for apply RAID config handler

Add a task which applies RAID configuration in
a fake mode.

Add an appropriate db migration, so the change
requires running syncdb.

Change-Id: Idfd31a9839309e8ac302aad6c78e6deaf7f7700a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/34/101534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_running_task(self, task_name, **kwargs): node_id = kwargs.get('node_id') name=task_name, node_id=node_id class ApplyNodeRAIDConfigurationTaskManager(TaskManager): def execute(self, node): node_id = node.id logger.info("Trying to start raid task") check_kwargs = {'node_id': node_id} self.check_running_task('raid', **check_kwargs) task = Task( name='raid', node_id=node_id) db().add(task) db().commit() self._call_silently( task, tasks.ApplyNodeRAIDConfigurationTask, node ) if task.status == 'error': raise Exception(task.message) return task

commit_message:
agent: raid support

  - add raid detection
  - lsi parsing realization
  - delay bypass

1) Detecting hardware raid vendor
2) Realized lsi parsing and adding parsed information to data section
3) Also added the ability to skip random delay with sleep-off argument

Change-Id: Ia8d52c64109584f56aeb407b4f0e14e8eaea861e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/36/101536/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :raid => raid_detect, def raid_detect case when check_raid =~ /LSI/ lsi_raid end end def check_raid # TODO: ruby >= 1.9 remove tr("\t", ' ') @check_raid ||= `lspci -vmm`.split(/^$/).map{|v| v = YAML.load(v.tr("\t", ' ')) }.select do |v| return v['Vendor'] if v && v['Device'] =~ /RAID/ return v['Vendor'] if v && v['Device'] =~ /Flash SSD/ end end def lsi_raid parsed_info = {:controllers => []} JSON.parse(`curl -X GET http://localhost:8080/v0.5/controllers/all`)['data'].each do |controller| structure = { :vendor => :lsi, :model => nil, :controller_id => nil, :pci_address => nil, :max_cachecade_size => nil, :enclosure => [], :physical_drives => [], :virtual_drives => [] } structure[:model] = controller['model'] structure[:controller_id] = controller['controller_id'] structure[:pci_address] = controller['pci_address'] structure[:enclosure] = controller['enclosures'] structure[:max_cachecade_size] = controller['capabilities']['max_cachecade_size'] controller['physical_drives'].each do |pd| structure[:physical_drives] << HardDisk.new(pd).to_report end controller['virtual_drives'].each do |vd| structure[:virtual_drives] << VirtDisk.new(vd).to_report end parsed_info[:controllers] << structure end parsed_info end class HardDisk KEYS = ['slot', 'state', 'enclosure', 'drive_group', 'size', 'interface', 'medium', 'sector_size', 'model'] def initialize(hash) @disks = {} hash.select{|k,v| KEYS.include? k }.map{|v| Hash[*v]}.each{|v| @disks.merge! v} # TODO: ruby <= 1.9 remove all in initialize and uncomment next line #@disks = hash.select{|k,v| KEYS.include? k } end def to_report @disks end end class VirtDisk KEYS = ['virtual_drive', 'drive_group', 'raid_level', 'state', 'access', 'consistent', 'write_cache', 'size', 'ssd_caching_active'] def initialize(hash) @disks = {} hash.select{|k,v| KEYS.include? k }.map{|v| Hash[*v]}.each{|v| @disks.merge! v} # TODO: ruby >= 1.9 remove all in initialize and uncomment next line #@disks = hash.select{|k,v| KEYS.include? k } end def to_report @disks end end sleep(sleep_time) unless ARGV.include? 'sleep-off'

commit_message:
Extenuate register_dhcp_agent code duplication in tests

Non-obvious changes:
* Change helpers.register_agent to use a slimmed down version
  of a plugin that knows how to register an agent. This allows
  the helper to be used with tests that do not register a core
  plugin.

Change-Id: Iefb1af676af6a984b01cdc1e9050541dffb5951a

commit_message:
UI change. Change on nodes tab

Changed page 'Configure Disks'. It added button switch between tab
'Disks' and tabs 'Raid Controller'. Tab 'Raid Controller' show all
virtual drives, HotSpare, NytroCache, CacheCade and unused disks
on this controller. Unused drives can be selected and added in new
virtual drives.

Change-Id: Ie9de1c74039a1b7c880e3520999a34f3405c5a44

commit_message:
Add new volume types

- image-cache type is for glance imag cache storag, that is mounted
  on /var/lib/glance/images-cache
- mysql is for mysql and is mounted on /var/lib/mysql

These volumes are optional, so set minimal size to 0. Also, make
'image' volume optional as well and set its minimal size to 0.

Change-Id: I0a376a9039d6d91dc167fa3869d530c736c0f6d1

commit_message:
Handle no disks in volume manager

During RAID configuration, it's possible that
we'll have no disks at all in the node metadata. So
handle that correctly without throwing an exception.

Change-Id: I48cd24d1cb064e5d4789ea77a65dc0a039fc7268
